item.description:
Release 2.0

Introducing the SwiftyLaunch Web Package, SwiftyLaunch Partner Program, and over 30 other additions!



Click here to read the blog post.

Overview of what's new:
New Additions
  • üåê New Package: SwiftyLaunch for Web - Upgrade your license and let SwiftyLaunch generate stunning landing pages for your Apps.
  • ü§ë SwiftyLaunch Partner Program: Become a Partner and earn 50% from SwiftyLaunch Sale referrals!
  • üé® 3 New App Styles: You can now choose between "Native", "Lollipop" and "Neobrutalism" styles for your iOS Applications.
  • ‚ú® Redesigned App Setup Process: Now with even more setup options and better organization
  • üîß Git Repo Automation: SwiftyLaunch can now initialze a Git repo with the necessary .gitignore file and add an initial commit on your behalf.
  • üõú New View Modifier: .requireNetwork()
  • Also a completely reworked foundation, completely reworked licensing system, loads of bug fixes and other improvements...

Update 1.5.1

In this release we are focused on reducing the amount of generation errors for our users. QoL, QoL, QoL!


  • On first app launch, SwiftyLaunch will now perform an extensive check for common generation errors, and make sure that all modules work correctly.
  • NO MORE BEACH BALLS DURING GENERATIONS! We adapted the generation to not run on main thread, so the UI doesn't get "stuck" during generation anymore. This confused many to think that SwiftyLaunch crashed. It did not. But now it's clearer for you.
  • If an app generation fails, we now show a large list of common fixes & troubleshooting steps for specific generation errors.
  • SwiftyLaunch only auto-detects Node.js installations when installed from the official website, nvm and brew. If you are running asdf, volta, or for some other reason it doesn't see your node installation, you now have an option to manually let Swifty know where your node installation is located.
  • On generation, SwiftyLaunch will also now automatically initialize a git repository and create an initial commit for you.
  • We have completely redesigned the Generation Screen to look more *fancy*.
  • Fixed generation artifacts in BackendKit for some module combinations.


Patch 1.5.0.1

Important: SwiftyLaunch now requires at least Xcode 15.3, and macOS Sonoma 14.0 or higher. Xcode 16 & macOS Sequoia recommended.


Overview of what's new:
  • Fixed an issue with "Unsupported Version" screen showing up too agressively. We tuned our feature flags logic and this should work as intended now.
  • Fixed leftover generation artifacts when AnalyticsKit was not selected with AuthKit & DBKit.
  • Fixed an edge case bug where SwiftyLaunch couldn't detect an accepted Xcode license agremeent.
  • Xcode can't handle underscores in bundle IDs. SwiftyLaunch allowed you to do that. This caused a generation error. Sorry. Updated the allowed characters list for App Name and Bundle ID
  • Added a close button to the required components sheet as you couldn't otherwise close the app without force-quitting


Release 1.5.0

Important: SwiftyLaunch now requires at least Xcode 15.3, and macOS Sonoma 14.0 or higher. Xcode 16 & macOS Sequoia recommended.

Click here to read the blog post

Overview of what's new:
New Additions
  • Supabase Integration Preview
  • Automatic Provider Linking
  • Granular Module Settings
  • Improved UI & UX
  • Preventive Checks to avoid common errors
  • Removed SlideOverCard Dependency in generated apps
  • Bug fixes

Patch 1.5.0.1

Important: SwiftyLaunch now requires at least Xcode 15.3, and macOS Sonoma 14.0 or higher. Xcode 16 & macOS Sequoia recommended.


Overview of what's new:
  • Fixed an issue with "Unsupported Version" screen showing up too agressively. We tuned our feature flags logic and this should work as intended now.
  • Fixed leftover generation artifacts when AnalyticsKit was not selected with AuthKit & DBKit.
  • Fixed an edge case bug where SwiftyLaunch couldn't detect an accepted Xcode license agremeent.
  • Xcode can't handle underscores in bundle IDs. SwiftyLaunch allowed you to do that. This caused a generation error. Sorry. Updated the allowed characters list for App Name and Bundle ID
  • Added a close button to the required components sheet as you couldn't otherwise close the app without force-quitting


Release 1.5.0

Important: SwiftyLaunch now requires at least Xcode 15.3, and macOS Sonoma 14.0 or higher. Xcode 16 & macOS Sequoia recommended.

Click here to read the blog post

Overview of what's new:
New Additions
  • Supabase Integration Preview
  • Automatic Provider Linking
  • Granular Module Settings
  • Improved UI & UX
  • Preventive Checks to avoid common errors
  • Removed SlideOverCard Dependency in generated apps
  • Bug fixes

Release 1.4.1

Important: SwiftyLaunch now requires at least Xcode 15, and macOS Ventura 13.5 or higher. Xcode 16 & macOS Sequoia recommended.

Overview of what's new:
New Additions
  • Feature Voting: You can now suggest new features and upvote other users suggestions.
  • Added an Acknowledgments Tab in SwiftyLaunch Settings
Changes:
  • Moved in-app notifications-related, showSignInSheet()-related and askUserFor()-related constants to Constants.swift
Bug Fixes:
  • Fixed a bug that would cause a crash when certain app icons were selected during project generation
  • Fixed a bug that would allow users to start a project generation with some of the app icons not selected, which would result in a crash


Release 1.4.0

Important: SwiftyLaunch now requires at least Xcode 15, and macOS Ventura 13.5 or higher. Xcode 16 & macOS Sequoia recommended.

Click here to read the blog post
Click here to read full patch notes

Overview of what's new:
New Additions
  • Added iPad Support
  • Generated apps are now iOS 18-ready
  • AdsKit is available
  • PostHog Session Recordings added to AnalyticsKit
  • Complete SwiftyLaunch App Redesign
  • Added ability to set default new project settings
  • Added ability to add Tuist to newly generated apps
Plus a lot more... Refer to the patch notes to read everything that's new.

Release 1.4.0.2

Important: SwiftyLaunch now requires at least Xcode 15, and macOS Ventura 13.5 or higher. Xcode 16 & macOS Sequoia recommended.

Overview of what's new:
Changes:
  • Moved in-app notifications-related, showSignInSheet()-related and askUserFor()-related constants to Constants.swift
Bug Fixes:
  • Fixed a bug that would cause a crash when certain app icons were selected during project generation
  • Fixed a bug that would allow users to start a project generation with some of the app icons not selected, which would result in a crash


Release 1.4.0

Important: SwiftyLaunch now requires at least Xcode 15, and macOS Ventura 13.5 or higher. Xcode 16 & macOS Sequoia recommended.

Click here to read the blog post

Overview of what's new:

  • Added iPad Support
  • Generated apps are now iOS 18-ready
  • AdsKit is available
  • PostHog Session Recordings added to AnalyticsKit
  • Complete SwiftyLaunch App Redesign
  • Added ability to set default new project settings
  • Added ability to add Tuist to newly generated apps
Plus a lot more... Refer to the patch notes to read everything that's new.

Release 1.4.0

Important: SwiftyLaunch now requires at least Xcode 15, and macOS Ventura 13.5 or higher. Xcode 16 & macOS Sequoia recommended.

Click here to read the blog post
Click here to read full patch notes

Overview of what's new:
New Additions
  • Added iPad Support
  • Generated apps are now iOS 18-ready
  • AdsKit is available
  • PostHog Session Recordings added to AnalyticsKit
  • Complete SwiftyLaunch App Redesign
  • Added ability to set default new project settings
  • Added ability to add Tuist to newly generated apps
Plus a lot more... Refer to the patch notes to read everything that's new.

Release 1.3.1

Click here to read about update 1.3 What's new: $55,000 of PostHog Credits for SwiftyLaunch Customers! ‚ö°Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏èü¶î
  • We partnered up with PostHog to help you out on your development journey! Details on how to claim the $55,000 in credits can be found on the framework selection screen
New Features
  • You can now select your own App Icon and Accent Color during project generation!
  • We‚Äôve updated the backend code to utilize OpenAI‚Äôs new GPT-4o in AIKit (instead of GPT-4 Turbo). Read more about GPT-4o API improvements here
  • We also tweaked SwiftyLaunch's User Interface in many small ways. Hope you'll like the changes!
Fixes
  • Error for a missing Node.js installation is now displayed correctly
  • Added detection for different types of Node.js installation (SwiftyLaunch can now see that you've already installed Node with brew! No need to install it again)
  • Fixed the post-generation code formatting script on Intel systems
  • Fixed inability to generate projects with AuthKit & DBKit disabled
  • Onboarding Views in the generated App is now being shown as expected
  • Fixed some OS version deprecation warnings
  • Fixed other edge case generation bugs üêû
Thanks to everyone who reported these issues! Together we make SwiftyLaunch a better platform for all iOS Developers out there üöÄ

Release 1.3.0

Read about this in our blog.
  • New Framework: AIKit (Including 3 AI-based mini Apps) ‚ú®
  • New Framework: AdsKit ü§ë (Coming later this month)
  • Added to AnalyticsKit: Crash Detection ‚õìÔ∏è‚Äçüí•
  • New Feature: Easily Request Capability Permission (Camera, Location, etc.) ‚úÖ
  • New Feature: Ask users to review your App ‚≠êÔ∏è
  • QOL Increased coverage of AnalyticsKit event and error tracking
  • Bug Fixes and Other Improvements
